Package at.altin.passwordsafe.passwordcommand.invoker

Class AbstractInvoker<T>

java.lang.Object
at.altin.passwordsafe.passwordcommand.invoker.AbstractInvoker<T>
Type Parameters:
T - type of operation (Function Interface)
Direct Known Subclasses:
PasswordFileOperationExecutor
public abstract class AbstractInvoker<T> extends Object
AbstractInvoker, which can be used for all invokers

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    private List<T>
    operations
    Operations (Commands) are stored in a list, so that we can manipulate them and also use for undo/redo, think like str+Z button in text editor, which undoes the last operation there is no limit for the number of operations, but it is limited by the memory

  • Field Details

    • operations

      private final List<T> operations
      Operations (Commands) are stored in a list, so that we can manipulate them and also use for undo/redo, think like str+Z button in text editor, which undoes the last operation there is no limit for the number of operations, but it is limited by the memory
      See Also:
      PasswordFileOperation

    • executeConsumer

      protected abstract void executeConsumer​(T operation) throws Exception
      child Class musst provide the logic for executing the operation, that can differ from invoker to invoker
      Parameters:
      operation - operation (Command) to be executed
      Throws:
      Exception - normally we define specific exceptions, in this case there are a lot of things that can go wrong
